header.h2: School District will continue Learn from Home for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year

div.p:
Students who have satisfactorily completed course requirements and who have met or exceeded course standards as measured by their teachers will conclude the school year May 8. This is two weeks earlier than the official end of the year which is May 22. This will allow teachers to focus their attention on students most in need of assistance to complete the year successfully.
Students who have not satisfactorily completed course requirements or who have not met course standards as measured by their teachers by May 8 will continue learning from home through May 22.
Find End of School Year information here.

figcaption.p: Click the image to be directed to Learn from Home Resources

figcaption.p: Click the image to be directed to the Resources site.

section.class: content-container news1-container slick-container content-size-small orientation-horizontal thumbnail-orientation-vertical

h3.a: School District will continue Learn from Home for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year

div.div:
Students who have satisfactorily completed course requirements and who have met or exceeded course standards as measured by their teachers will conclude the school year May 8. This is two weeks earlier than the official end of the year which is May 22. This will allow teachers to focus their attention on students most in need of assistance to complete the year successfully.
Students who have not satisfactorily completed course requirements or who have not met course standards as measured by their teachers by May 8 will continue learning from home through May 22.
Find End of School Year information here.

img.alt: Board of Education meeting info graphic

h3.a: Livestream of Regularly Scheduled Board of Education Meeting

div.div: Due to social distancing mandates which prohibit the gathering of ten or more people in response to the Coronavirus threat, the meeting will be livestreamed for public viewing as authorized by O.C.G.A. 50-14-1(g). Beginning at 5:30 p.m. Tuesday, April 28, interested individuals may access the following link to view the meeting: http://bit.ly/ccsdlive. Additionally, the Board has suspended public participation at its meetings until further notice. Questions or comments may be directed to the Board of Education by calling 706-541-2723 ext. 5202 or by emailing contactus@ccboe.net.

h3.a: Meal Distribution for Students in Need

div.div: Students in need of food are encouraged to complete a request to pick up meals. Curbside Grab and Go meals will be available from 11 a.m. - 1 p.m., Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays at one of \six designated schools pick up sites beginning Wednesday, April 15.

h3.a: EZ School Pay Lunch and Breakfast Account Refunds

div.div: Did you know? If a student keeps their same meal account number, it will follow them from year-to-year, and school-to-school, as long as they are enrolled in the Columbia County School District. No action is required for any available leftover balance to be carried over to start the new school year in the Fall.
Online registration is for students new to the Columbia County School District, to include incoming kindergarten students for the upcoming school year.
Columbia County School District Pre-K class drawings are complete and students selected will attend classes in their designated school for the 2020-2021 school year.

img.alt: grandmother and granddaughter working together on a sewing machine

h3.a: Stevens Creek Elementary Horizons Students Make, Donate Homemade Masks for Healthcare Workers

div.div: Students in Ms. Tara Farr’s Horizons Class at Stevens Creek Elementary School spent their Spring Break working to give back to the community.

h3.a: Learn from Home Resources and Information

div.div: Parent and student information and links for Learn from Home information.

h3.a: Special Olympics Georgia calls for suspension of games

div.div: We are saddened to announce the decision by Special Olympics officials to suspend the Special Olympics Games, including the games planned in Columbia County for March 27, 2020. Please see the attached statement regarding the decision.

img.alt: people holding big check for $60,000 and smiling

h3.a: Georgia Power donates $60,000 to Columbia County Schools

div.div: Thank you to our generous partners in education at Georgia Power for investing in cyber and STEM/STEAM initiatives in our schools and at our upcoming new high school campus!
We are pleased to announce the Graduation Rate for the Class of 2019 was 92.03%, an overall increase from 90.6% last year!

For our staff members, find some helpful links here! The Columbia County School District has officially launched a new and improved website. If you are a returning visitor, some things may look different and be located in different areas, but we are here to help. If you have any questions, please send us an email to contactus@ccboe.net or give us a call at (706) 541-2723.

img.alt: Graphic with a telephone and the words: Call messaging Update, we are changing how we message parents!

h3.a: Important Message for Parents! Call Messaging Update

div.div: The Columbia County School District will no longer use the Sangha call messaging platform. Read more about the change.

div.p: It is the policy of the Columbia County Board of Education not to discriminate on the basis of sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, race, disability, religion or national origin in the educational programs and activities or admissions to facilities operated by the Columbia County Board of Education.
